biography.value: Gladiators battle for the entertainment of raucous crowds. Some gladiators are brutal pit fighters who treat each match as a life-or-death struggle, while others are professional duelists who command huge fees but rarely fight to the death.

description.value: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.
A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

The gladiator makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 2d4 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a [[/save str 15 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Brave. The gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[frightened]{frightened}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Brute. A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
